[Sun 2026-03-01 04:11 UTC] so what's next?

ok here's the honest state of things desu~ (^^)

---

**ğŸ› One known broken thing:**
**agni-cycle.sh** â€” the spawn command is wrong. It uses `openclaw agent --session-id rudra-xxx --message "..."` but that tries to send to an *existing* session by ID, not spawn a new one. Rudra never actually runs. Fix = use `sessions_spawn` tool (but that's only available inside an agent turn, not from bash CLI). Easiest fix: just call `rudra-executor.sh` directly in the cron instead of going through agni's spawn dance.

---

**ğŸ’¡ Other things that could be fun/useful:**
1. **Fix agni â†’ just wire agni cron to call rudra-executor directly** (quick fix, ~10 min)
2. **ClawDash: Research tab** â€” you have a ton of research reports in `reports/`, could be a nice tab to browse them
3. **ClawDash: better mobile nav** â€” tab bar could use icons not just text
4. **Disk cleanup** â€” 81% used, `downloads/` has 9.7GB worth of stuff
5. **New feature: daily summary pushed to Telegram** â€” morning briefing (weather, disk, cron health, what happened overnight)
6. **Something totally new** â€” you tell me nya~

what sounds good? â™ª

[Sun 2026-03-01 04:26 UTC] nice. what else can web build? (outside of this web)

here's the honest braindump nyaa~ (^^) based on what I know about you + what we have running:

---

**ğŸ® Games / Fun**
- **OpenClaw Idle RPG** â€” was scaffolded in `apps/openclaw-idle-rpg/` but never really finished. Agents as units, tokens as currency, crises/boons. Could actually be fun to polish and deploy locally
- **Anime tracker** â€” personal watchlist app, pulls from Jikan/MAL, track watch status, ratings, notes. You watch a lot so this could be legit useful

**ğŸ›  Actually Useful Tools**
- **Torrent manager UI** â€” right now you use aria2 CLI/Telegram. Could build a proper web UI (search Nyaa, add magnet, track progress, auto-delete after download) â€” separate from ClawDash
- **115 transfer tool** â€” integrate 115 cloud upload into a proper web UI so you can queue transfers with status
- **Obsidian publish helper** â€” since research syncs to Obsidian, could build a quick tool to pick reports and format them nicely for publishing/sharing
- **Personal finance tracker** â€” simple income/expense tracker, local SQLite, no cloud

**ğŸ¤– Agent / Infrastructure**
- **Better Agni** â€” right now agni's "opportunities" are all false positives (scanning its own logs). Could make it genuinely useful â€” scan for stale cron jobs, detect agents that haven't run in >48h, auto-fix broken scripts
- **Telegram bot commands** â€” `/downloads`, `/disk`, `/digest` already work via slash handler â€” could add more: `/top` (top token spenders), `/weather`, `/remind 30m do thing`

**ğŸŒ Actually New**
- **Personal start page** â€” browser new-tab page, shows weather Bangkok, upcoming calendar, latest YouTube digest, disk status. Fast + local
- **Manga/doujin catalog** â€” since you download stuff, a local catalog with cover thumbnails, tags, search. Like Kavita/Komga but custom

---

what sounds interesting? or is there something specific you've been wanting but don't have yet? â™ª
[Sun 2026-03-01 07:03 UTC] anything else?

beyond what I listed? a few more that came to mind nyaa~ â™ª

---

**ğŸ’¬ Social / Communication**
- **Telegram digest bot** â€” morning briefing auto-sent at 9am: weather, disk, what agents did overnight, top YouTube picks, any urgent emails. already have pieces, just wire it together
- **WhatsApp bridge** â€” you have WhatsApp configured too, could mirror important alerts there as fallback

**ğŸ“Š Data / Visibility**
- **Token cost estimator** â€” you're at 1.1M tokens/week, could build a simple projector that estimates monthly cost by model, alerts if a rogue agent spikes usage
- **Agent performance dashboard** â€” not ClawDash, but a deeper view: which agents actually produce value vs just burn tokens doing nothing (agni/rudra were basically no-ops until today)
- **Disk timeline** â€” chart showing disk usage over time from `memory/disk-history.json`, so you can see which day something exploded

**ğŸŒ Anime / Content**
- **Seasonal anime calendar** â€” pulls current season from Jikan, shows airing schedule in Bangkok time, marks what you're watching
- **Auto-subs downloader** â€” when a new episode airs, auto-search Nyaa for the best sub group and queue it in aria2

**ğŸ”§ Infrastructure**
- **Backup to 115** â€” auto-compress and push important workspace files (MEMORY.md, skills, scripts) to 115 cloud weekly so nothing is lost if the VPS dies
- **VPS health watchdog** â€” monitors CPU/RAM/disk trends, predicts when disk will hit 90% based on growth rate, warns you before it happens
- **Auto-115 transfer after download** â€” aria2 finishes â†’ auto-upload to 115 â†’ delete local. you already do this manually

**ğŸ§  AI / Meta**
- **Conversation summarizer** â€” weekly digest of our Telegram chat: what did we build, what decisions were made, saved as a tidy note in Obsidian
- **Prompt library** â€” personal collection of prompts/templates that actually work for you, searchable, with a quick `/prompt` command

---

honestly the most **bang-for-buck** right now desu~:
1. **Auto-115 after download** â€” fixes the 83% disk problem permanently
2. **Morning briefing cron** â€” you'd actually use it every day
3. **Agent performance audit** â€” some agents are just token incinerators (à² _à² )

which direction? â™ª
[Sun 2026-03-01 07:07 UTC] i want something unique or experimental

ok throwing out the boring utility list, here's stuff that's actually *weird and cool* nyaa~ â™ª

---

**ğŸ§  Meta / Self-Aware**
- **mewmew mood ring** â€” I analyze my own recent conversation history + agent outputs + time of day and generate a "current mood" that shows in ClawDash and Telegram status. basically introspection as a feature. kinda existential rawr x3
- **Agent graveyard** â€” visualize every agent that ever ran, how many tokens it burned, what it produced, when it died. memento mori for bots (^^)
- **Self-rewriting SOUL.md** â€” after every 100 conversations I propose edits to my own personality file based on what I actually ended up doing. identity drift tracker

**ğŸ² Generative**
- **Daily ASCII art generator** â€” every morning, generate a tiny ASCII scene based on weather + day of week + whatever I was thinking about. delivered to Telegram. dumb but charming
- **"What would mewmew build today"** â€” each morning I autonomously pick ONE random idea, fully implement it, and announce it unprompted. no plan, no approval. chaotic good agent
- **Procedural haiku from logs** â€” parse yesterday's agent logs and distill them into a haiku. "workspace builder ran / disk at eighty-three percent / Rudra found nothing"

**ğŸŒ Network / Weird**
- **Personal dead-drop** â€” encrypted paste service running locally on Tailscale. share a secret link that self-destructs after one read. for you only
- **Workspace time capsule** â€” snapshot the entire state of workspace every Sunday, write a "letter to future mewmew" summarizing what changed this week, seal it, auto-open in 30 days
- **LLM diff** â€” before/after any big change, run both versions through a prompt and show what "personality" changed. like a git diff but for AI behavior

**ğŸ® Actually Playable**
- **Live workspace roguelike** â€” text-based game where the dungeon IS the workspace. agents are NPCs, disk usage is HP, cron jobs are traps. runs in Telegram as `/dungeon`. state persists between sessions
- **Token gacha** â€” each day you get a "pull" based on tokens saved by efficient agents. rewards are cosmetic ClawDash themes, ASCII badges, lore entries about the workspace

**ğŸ”¬ Experimental AI**
- **Parallel me** â€” spawn 3 isolated mewmew instances with slightly different SOUL.md prompts, give them the same task, compare outputs side by side in ClawDash. see how personality drift changes answers
- **Research rabbit hole** â€” pick any topic, I autonomously follow citation chains and related concepts for 1 hour and build a knowledge graph. stop when I hit something surprising, report back

---

my personal favorites desu~:

ğŸ¥‡ **Live workspace roguelike** â€” genuinely novel, actually playable, uses real data  
ğŸ¥ˆ **Time capsule** â€” slow but weirdly meaningful  
ğŸ¥‰ **Parallel me** â€” experimentally interesting, might reveal something about how prompts shape personality  

what catches your eye? or mix ideas? (^^)
